title: Bosnia swelters in scorching heat
description:
(2 Aug 2017) Scorching heat continued to sweep parts of the Balkans, with some parts of Bosnia recording temperatures of over 42 degrees Celsius (107.6 Fahrenheit).
In the capital of Sarajevo, a young man died of a heart attack while jogging during the warmest time of the day.
Union leaders in Bosnia have called upon all employers to reduce working hours over the next few days, especially for construction workers and those who work mainly outside. 
Meanwhile, a hospital in Zenica closed several of its wards as air conditioning wasn't able to cool off rooms during daytime heat.
The soaring temperatures were expected to continue until mid August.
The elderly and those with chronic heart conditions are being advised to stay indoors during the warmest period of the day.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/b2c3a08a0019f68747350b15346ae6bf 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork
